pages.text:
About Us
Chamber office/staff available to Chamber Members from 9am-5pm
.
The Sebastian River Area Chamber of Commerce was incorporated in February, 1958, over sixty five years ago, and was established to promote the civic, economic and social welfare of the people in the Sebastian River Area. We serve the communities in Wabasso, Fellsmere, Grant, Micco, Little Hollywood, and Sebastian, including all of the unincorporated areas of North Indian River County and South Brevard. We represent over 500 businesses and not for profit service organizations in the community.
The Chamber is a volunteer driven organization and our mission statement is to be a proactive, member supported association of businesses, organizations and individuals, united in their effort to support a healthy business environment, promote business development, encourage growth of tourism and to use its collective strength to enhance the quality of life in the community.
We are located in the heart of Sebastian at 700 Main St, on the southeast corner of U.S. One and Main, overlooking the Indian River Lagoon and the Main St. Boat Ramp and dock.
We strive to maintain that "small town - friendly" atmosphere, and our Visitor's Center and Information Office welcomes over seven thousand tourists and visitors every year, providing information on recreation, eco-tourism activities, our county's natural resources, referrals to our business members, calendars of events, etc. We try very hard to make people see what is best about the Sebastian area, and promote our special and unique piece of paradise here in Florida.
.fl-post-content

Festivals & Special Events
The Sebastian River Area (SRA) is home to many unique and flavorful festivals. From frog legs and gator tail to clams and craft brews, your palate will love the culinary variety that our festivals have to offer! We also boast some of the biggest art, music, and nature festivals around!
2025 Events & Festivals

Sebastian Clambake Festival
Event Date: 7-9, 2025
Friday | SaturdayÂ  | Sunday
Held the first weekend in November, this event serves up clams in a variety of ways, highlighting the working waterfront heritage of the Lagoon to our yearly visitors.Â  Held at Riverview Park, the Clambake Foundation gives thousands of dollars back to the community with their grant programs for capital improvement projects for not for profits. For more information, visit
www.sebastianclambake.org
Light Up Night
Date: December 2025
The entire business community opens its doors and lights up the night for residents and visitors showing their customers appreciation. On the first Friday after Thanksgiving weekend, kick off the holiday season with this very popular community-wide event. Businesses go all out with their decorations and serve old fashion eggnog, cookies and other holiday goodies as well as offering special deals and sidewalk sales.
Sebastian Craft Brew Hullabaloo
Date: December 2025
Hosted by the Rotary Club of Sebastian, participating breweries include: Mash Monkeys, Pareidolia, Intracoastal Brewing Company, Sailfish Brewery, Pierced Ciderworks, American Icon Brewing, Local Home Brewers and many more. The focus is on FLORIDA ONLY breweries, wineries and cideries. FRIENDLY PETS ON LEASHES ALLOWED.
Bring a folding chair and enjoy a free concert too!
AN LITTLE BACKGROUND:
The Rotary Club of Sebastian, through its fundraisers - Craft Brew Hullabaloo, the Annual Golf Outing and River Days (which is held in March) - are poised to raise $25,000 + annually that will go back to the community through the schools, High School athletic teams, the maintenance of our Riverview Park (City of Sebastian) and local non-profits.
The Rotary Club of Sebastianâs charitable efforts is a registered 501-3(c)
TICKETS AVAILABLE IN OCTOBER:
Christmas Parade (City Sponsored event)
Date: December 2025
A must see! Bring your lawn chairs and get ready to see our community ring in the holiday season. Parade starts at the boat ramp and continues to Riverview Park for a fun family celebration.
If your business or organization is interested in participating in the parade, please call the City of Sebastian for full details.
Visit,
https://www.sebastian100.com/
2026 Events & Festivals
Concerts
in the ParkÂ
Riverview Park | Sebastian
Concerts in the Park is a series of eight outdoor concerts held at Riverview Park, along the Indian River Lagoon. Presented in partnership with the City of Sebastian, the Sebastian River Area Chamber, and its business sponsors, this event brings live musical talent and promotes the Chamber businesses with style. Every attendee receives a free raffle ticket for a chance to win prizes donated from local Chamber Members. Food vendors on site.
Call the SRA Chamber for more information and sponsorship 772-589-5969.

Fellsmere Frog Leg Festival
Date: January 2026 TBD
Thursday & Friday 4pm - 11pmÂ  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Saturday 10am â 11pm / Sunday 11am â 6pm
Downtown FellsmereÂ  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  22 South Orange Street, Fellsmere, 32948
Four days of frog legs, carnival rides, and live entertainment, this volunteer-based event began as a way to raise money for the recreational needs of the children in Fellsmere.Â  A winner of two Guinness Book of World Records for most frogs sold at a festival, the Fellsmere Frog Leg Festival attracts over 80,000 people to the area and has donated hundreds of thousands of dollars back into the community over the last 31 years! Whether youâre joining us for the famous mouthwatering frog leg and gator tail dinners, browsing the hundreds of booths for unique gifts, or listening to great music and enjoying the fun rides - youâll immediately know why this festival has become an annual tradition for so many. The main feature is, of course, the mouthwatering frog leg and gator tail dinners; however, thereâs also a huge variety of other tasty foods to choose from like hamburgers, hotdogs, pizza, fried dough, turkey legs, sandwiches of all kinds, ice cream, candy apples, popcorn and more. There are rides for the young insâ as well as wild and crazy rides for the more adventurous, and plenty of games to test your skills. There's free admission, free parking, and free entertainment. For more information, visit
www.froglegfestival.com
Sebastian Fine Arts and Music Festival
January, TBD 2026
Saturday | 10-5pm
Sunday | 10-4pm
Riverview Park
600 U.S. Hwy 1 Sebastian, FL 32958
The Sebastian Fine Arts and Music Festival began in 1999.Â  It features a juried art show and live musical performances under the shade of tall trees along the breathtaking Indian River Lagoon. With over 100 local professional artists, musicians and craftsmen showcasing their talents, the Fine Arts & Music Festival attracts over 20,000 residents and visitors annually. For more information, visitÂ
www.sebastianartshow.com

River DaysÂ featuresÂ FREE entry, parking, live music, craft booths, and tons of family fun!
River DaysÂ is an annual 3-day celebration held in the historic city of Sebastian, Florida! This weekend long festival, brought to you by theÂ Rotary Club of SebastianÂ and theÂ City of Sebastian, will raise funds to support youth sports and organizations throughout North Indian River County.
SCHEDULE OF EVENTS INCLUDE:
https://www.riverdaysfl.com/schedule.html
Free concerts FRIDAY, SATURDAY & SUNDAY
Car Show | SUNDAY
Pancake Breakfast | SUNDAY
Pie Baking Competition | SUNDAY
Chili competition | SATURDAY
Kids Zone | by Home Depot | SATURDAY & SUNDAY
Farmers Market | SUNDAY
Daytime Pontoon Boat Parade | SATURDAY
We invite you and your family to join us for this fun-packed festival and to enjoy delicious dishes prepared in a variety of palette pleasing recipes by the Sebastian River High School Culinary Arts Program and other food trucks too! Kid friendly food options will also be available.
______________________________________
The Rotary Club of Sebastian is dedicated to providing business, professional and community leaders an opportunity for service to others in order to benefit our community and to promote high ethical standards, fellowship and goodwill worldwide. To learn more about the Rotary Club of Sebastian, please visitÂ www.sebastianrotary.com.
For more information, check out
www.RiverDaysFL.com

IGNITE YOUR SUMMER BUSINESS Produced by the Sebastian River Area Chamber of Commerce, this community-wide open house event is designed to create a boost in business during the notoriously slower months of summer. Participating locations offer sales, discounts, and door prizes on the night of the event along with family-fun activities, food, and refreshments.
Location * ONLY BUSINESSES LOCATED MORE THAN 2 MILES FROM THE CHAMBER ARE ELIGIBLE TO PARTIICIPATE AT OUR LOCATION. Fees/Admission Register for Grill Out Night and have your brand be seen by thousands! Deadline to be included in printed marketing material is August 1st Registration through July at 5 PM Members: $40 | Non Members: $80
The 2025 Event Sponsors were: Woody's Bar-B-Q Robin Raiff Team at Douglas Elliman Real Estate Thank you to everyone who participated and attended the event. A special thanks to out chamber ambassadors who helped behind the scenes top make the event a success!
